body_html:
go to a newer version of TF..the issue is driven by your version of Bazel no problems with TF R1.8 and Bazel 0.13 as of about a week ago d
…
On Fri, May 18, 2018 at 3:28 PM, JosephIWB ***@***.***> wrote: hello, I have the same problem, Have I written custom code: No OS: Ubuntu 16.04 TensorFlow installed from: Source TensorFlow version: r1.4 Bazel version: 0.9.0 (version 0.13.0 fails to check that it is superior to version 0.4.5 -.-) CUDA: 8.0 cuDNN: 5 GPU model and memory: gtx 1050 TI (notebook) 2001MB Driver: 384.130 (other drivers cause conflict -.-) Exact command to reproduce: bazel build -c opt --copt=-mavx --copt=-mavx2 --copt=-mfma --copt=-mfpmath=both --copt=-msse4.2 tensorflow:libtensorflow_cc.so using --incompatible_load_argument_is_label=false "solves" the problem — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#15492 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIUuT94C4HgKLdbUVXid4EDKUUbsgbz9ks5tz0skgaJpZM4RHdW7> .
body_text:
go to a newer version of TF..the issue is driven by your version of Bazel
no problems with TF R1.8 and Bazel 0.13 as of about a week ago
d
…
On Fri, May 18, 2018 at 3:28 PM, JosephIWB ***@***.***> wrote:
 hello, I have the same problem,
 Have I written custom code: No
 OS: Ubuntu 16.04
 TensorFlow installed from: Source
 TensorFlow version: r1.4
 Bazel version: 0.9.0 (version 0.13.0 fails to check that it is superior to
 version 0.4.5 -.-)
 CUDA: 8.0
 cuDNN: 5
 GPU model and memory: gtx 1050 TI (notebook) 2001MB
 Driver: 384.130 (other drivers cause conflict -.-)
 Exact command to reproduce:
 bazel build -c opt --copt=-mavx --copt=-mavx2 --copt=-mfma
 --copt=-mfpmath=both --copt=-msse4.2 tensorflow:libtensorflow_cc.so

 using --incompatible_load_argument_is_label=false "solves" the problem

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#15492 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AIUuT94C4HgKLdbUVXid4EDKUUbsgbz9ks5tz0skgaJpZM4RHdW7>
 .
body:
go to a newer version of TF..the issue is driven by your version of Bazel
no problems with TF R1.8 and Bazel 0.13 as of about a week ago
d


On Fri, May 18, 2018 at 3:28 PM, JosephIWB <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> hello, I have the same problem,
> Have I written custom code: No
> OS: Ubuntu 16.04
> TensorFlow installed from: Source
> TensorFlow version: r1.4
> Bazel version: 0.9.0 (version 0.13.0 fails to check that it is superior to
> version 0.4.5 -.-)
> CUDA: 8.0
> cuDNN: 5
> GPU model and memory: gtx 1050 TI (notebook) 2001MB
> Driver: 384.130 (other drivers cause conflict -.-)
> Exact command to reproduce:
> bazel build -c opt --copt=-mavx --copt=-mavx2 --copt=-mfma
> --copt=-mfpmath=both --copt=-msse4.2 tensorflow:libtensorflow_cc.so
>
> using --incompatible_load_argument_is_label=false "solves" the problem
>
